Activity: Arrive at the office. Review schedule and prepare for the day. Check emails.
Focus on EHR data quality issues, particularly those flagged by clinical staff feedback. Investigate specific cases reported in the feedback forms.

Meet with @ehrdev-1 and @ehrdev-2 (EHR Integration Developers) to discuss the data quality issues identified and explore potential solutions through system modifications or data validation rules. Prioritize fixes based on clinical impact.

Review the proposed dashboard design from @da-1 and @da-2 for visualizing influenza trends. Provide feedback on the layout, data representation, and functionality. Ensure it meets the needs of clinical users.

Attend the weekly IT Department meeting to discuss project updates, resource allocation, and potential roadblocks. Advocate for the necessary resources to address the identified data quality issues and system improvements.

Work with @qatest-1 and @qatest-2 (Quality Assurance Testers) to develop a test plan for validating the data quality fixes and system modifications implemented by the EHR developers. Define clear acceptance criteria for each fix.

Review the feedback received from physicians and nurses regarding the training materials. Brainstorm ideas with @trainer-1 on how to improve the clarity, relevance, and accessibility of the materials. Consider incorporating more hands-on exercises and real-world scenarios.
Communicate to the clinical staff that the feedback has been actively read and processed, and that a systematical solution is underway. @PEOPLE.
Prepare materials for tomorrow's meeting with the physicians. Summarize key findings and potential solutions.
Update Project Plan with progress made during the week and revise the plan for next week
